Monday, June 11, 2007























Immigration bill crashes
A "grand compromise" immigration bill aimed at legalizing and penalizing millions of people who are unlawfully in the United States has suffered a stunning setback in the Senate, costing President Bush perhaps his best opportunity to win a top domestic priority.
FULL STORY


























The Situation Room, weekdays 4 p.m. & 7 p.m. ET
Watch "The Situation Room," anchored by Wolf Blitzer, for complete, up-to-the minute coverage of the day's events. Tune in to "The Situation Room" weekdays from 4 to 6 p.m. and from 7 to 8 p.m. ET.

For a daily sneak preview of the show and an early read on the day's political news sign up for "The Situation Room" daily email newsletter at http://www.CNN.com/situationroom.






















Libby gets 30 months in leak case
"Scooter" Libby, former chief of staff to Vice President Dick Cheney, was sentenced Tuesday to 30 months in prison for lying to investigators probing the leak of a CIA operative's identity.
FULL STORY






Stem cells vote sets up veto fight 
Congress cleared legislation Thursday easing restrictions on federal funding for embryonic stem cell research, but not by enough votes to override a promised veto.
FULL STORY






Ex-official: Cheney opposed promotion
Vice President Cheney opposed a promotion for a deputy involved in a dispute over the controversial domestic surveillance program, a former deputy attorney general told senators.
FULL STORY






Pace replaced in top military job
Anticipation of a "contentious" confirmation process prompted the decision to replace Gen. Peter Pace as chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, Defense Secretary Robert Gates said.
FULL STORY
